Helper Classes¶

NTP Checker¶

Check Time from NTP Server

platform:Linux
synopsis:NTP Check
helper_check_ntp.time_in_sync()¶

check if local time is in sync with NTP server time

checks against time_server defined in helper_check_ntp.

Returns:If local and Server time are in sync it return True

Audio Helper¶

Functions to open audio files and to record from default microphone

platform:Linux
synopsis:Audio Helper
helper_audio.load_mono(filename)¶

load mono audio file with gstreamer

Parameters:filename (str) – name of file, relative path
Returns:data – Channel as list
Returns:samplerate – Samplerate of audio file
helper_audio.load_stereo(filename)¶

load stereo audio file with gstreamer

Parameters:filename (str) – name of file, relative path
Returns:left_channel – Left channel as list
Returns:right_channel – Right channel as list
Returns:samplerate – Samplerate of audio file
helper_audio.load_wave_with_scipy(wavFile)¶

load Wave File with build in function from Scipy

Can only open .wav files

Warning

It has problems with many codecs

Parameters:filename (str) – name of file, relative path
Returns:left_channel – Left channel as list
Returns:right_channel – Right channel as list
Returns:samplerate – Samplerate of audio file

Implementation¶

Functions used by server and client

platform:Linux
synopsis:Functions used by server and client
helper_implementation.generate_key_for_aes(codeword)¶

take the codeword generated with Fuzzy Cryptography, and reformat it to use it as AES key.

AES keys:
  • AES uses 256 Bit=32 Bytes as Keys
  • Every character in AES key is 8 Bits
Codewords:
  • Codewords are 512 symbols long
  • Every symbol has numbers from 0 to (0 to 1023)
Mapping Codewords to AES keys:
  • Add every 16 numbers blocks
  • Mapping symbols to numbers from 0 to (0 to 255) with modulo
Parameters:codeword (list) – 512 symbols long codeword list
Returns:32 byte key for AES
helper_implementation.get_possible_fingerprints(recording_data, recording_samplerate)¶

generate many fingerprints varying in time

Parameters:
  • recording_data – complete recording data
  • recording_samplerate – samplerate of recording
Returns:

many fingerprints
helper_implementation.move_data_left(data, steps)¶

move data to the left and fill rest with zeros

Parameters:
  • data – chunks of data
  • steps (int) – steps to move
Returns:

data
helper_implementation.move_data_right(data, steps)¶

move data to the right and fill rest with zeros

Parameters:
  • data – chunks of data
  • steps (int) – steps to move
Returns:

data

Analysis¶

Helper Functions

platform:Linux
synopsis:Helper Functions
helper_analysis.absolute_distance(fingerprint1, fingerprint2)¶

Calculate absolute distance

Parameters:
  • fingerprint1 – List with numbers
  • fingerprint2 – List with numbers
helper_analysis.hamming_distance(fingerprint1, fingerprint2)¶

Number of ciphers that are different in fingerprint1 compared to fingerprint2

Parameters:
  • fingerprint1 – List with numbers
  • fingerprint2 – List with numbers
helper_analysis.hamming_weight(fingerprint)¶

Number of ciphers in fingerprint that are not 0

Parameters:fingerprint – List with numbers
